close something ↔ out.translation[0].def: to finish in a particular way
The bond market closed out the week on a strong note.
if a store closes out a type of goods, they sell all of them cheaply
We’re closing out this line of swimwear.
close something ↔ out.translation[1].def: if a store closes out a type of goods, it sells all of them cheaply
We’re closing out this line of swimwear.
